actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.
Consideration initiated by previous order of the House.
Considered by previous order of the House.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the order of the House of Wednesday, May 8, 1991, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the bill.
DEBATE - The House continued with debate.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous  order of the House.
Mr. Miller (OH) moved to recommit to Appropriations.
On motion to recommit Failed by voice vote.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 384 - 25 (Roll no. 84).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 237 proposed by Senator Byrd.
Amendment SP 237 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 238 proposed by Senator Byrd for Senator Hollings.
Amendment SP 238 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 239 proposed by Senator Byrd for Senator Burdick.
Amendment SP 239 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Amendment SP 240 proposed by Senator Byrd for Senator Leahy.
Amendment SP 240 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Whitten asked unanimous consent that the House disagree to the Senate amendments.
On motion that the House disagree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: Disagrees to Senate amemdments.

Senate insists on its amendments, asks for a conference, appoints conferees Byrd; Inouye; Hollings; Johnston; Burdick; Leahy; Sasser; DeConcini; Bumpers; Lautenberg; Harkin; Mikulski; Reid; Adams; Fowler; Kerrey; Hatfield; Stevens; Garn; Cochran; Kasten; D'Amato; Rudman; Specter; Domenici; Nickles; Gramm; Bond; Gorton.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Whitten asked unanimous consent that the House disagree to the Senate amendments, and agree to a conference.
On motion that the House disagree to the Senate amendments, and agree to a conference Agreed to without objection.

The chair appointed conferees: Whitten, Natcher, Smith (IA), Yates, Obey, Roybal, Bevill, Murtha, Traxler, Lehman (FL), Dixon, Fazio, Hefner, McDade, Myers, Miller (OH), Young (FL), Edwards (OK), Rogers, and Skeen.
By unanimous consent, the Speaker reserved the authority to make additional appointments of conferees.
Mr. Whitten asked unanimous consent that managers on the part of the House have until midnight on May 21 to file a conference report on H.R. 2251. Agreed to without objection.
Conference report H. Rept. 102-71 filed with 3 amendments in disagreement. Filed late, pursuant to previous special order.
Conferees agreed to file conference report.

CONSIDERATION OF LEGISLATION - Mr. Whitten asked unanimous consent that it shall be in order at any time today, or any day thereafter, notwithstanding section 302(f) of the Congressional Budget Act, to consider the conference report and amendments in disagreement, and motions to dispose of amendments in disagreement, on the bill H.R. 2251. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Whitten brought up conference report H.Rept. 102-71 by previously agreed to special order.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the order of the House agreed to earlier today, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the conference report.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the conference report Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 387 - 33 (Roll no. 113).
Mr. Whitten moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 2.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 2 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Whitten moved that the House recede and concur in the Senate amendment No. 3.
On motion that the House recede and concur in the Senate amendment No. 3 Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Whitten moved that the House recede and concur with an amendment in the Senate amendment No. 7.
On motion that the House recede and concur with amendment in the Senate amendment No. 7 Agreed to without objection.
Motions to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Senate agreed to conference report by Voice Vote.
Senate concurred in the House amendment to the Senate amendments nos. 2 and 7 by Voice Vote.
Conference papers: message on House action held at the desk in Senate.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-55.

official_title: Making dire emergency supplemental appropriations from contributions of foreign governments and/or interest for humanitarian assistance to refugees and displaced persons in and around Iraq as a result of the recent invasion of Kuwait and for peacekeeping activities, and for other urgent needs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1991, and for other purposes.
short_title: Dire Emergency Supplemental Appropriations from Contributions of Foreign Governments and/or Interest for Humanitarian Assistance to Refugees and Displaced Persons In and Around Iraq as a Result of the Recent Invasion of Kuwait and for Peacekeeping Activities and Other Urgent Needs Act of 1991

summary.as: House receded and concurred with amendment
summary.text: Dire Emergency Supplemental Appropriations from Contributions of Foreign Governments and/or Interest for Humanitarian Assistance to Refugees and Displaced Persons In and Around Iraq as a Result of the Recent Invasion of Kuwait and for Peacekeeping Activities and Other Urgent Needs Act of 1991 - Makes emergency supplemental appropriations for FY 1991 to carry out this Act. Chapter I: Department of Defense - Military - Makes the Persian Gulf Regional Defense Fund available for the costs of the Department of Defense incurred in connection with Operation Provide Comfort and other humanitarian efforts for the relief of refugees and displaced persons in and around Iraq. Authorizes the Secretary of Defense to transfer a specified amount from the Fund from amounts appropriated for Operation Desert Shield/Operation Desert Storm to military personnel and operation and maintenance accounts for the cost of humanitarian relief efforts. Appropriates a specified amount from the Defense Cooperation Account for contributions to military relief societies. Sets forth general provisions concerning the transfers of funds. Chapter II: Department of State - Provides for the transfer of specified amount of funds from the Defense Cooperation Account to certain Department of State accounts for: (1) emergency assistance for refugees and other displaced persons in and around Iraq and for peacekeeping activities and international disaster assistance (authorizes a specified amount of such funds for the Agency for International Development) in the Persian Gulf region; (2) migration and refugee assistance (authorizes a specified amount of such funds for the Department of State Office of Refugee Programs); and (3) the U.S. Emergency Refugee and Migration Assistance Fund. Sets forth general provisions concerning the transfers of funds. Provides that amounts obligated for international disaster assistance in connection with the Persian Gulf crisis for FY 1991 and the value of defense articles and services and military education and training authorized to be drawn down as of April 20, 1991, under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 shall not be counted against ceiling limitations. Prohibits economic support fund assistance allocated for Pakistan under the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1991 from being made available for assistance to another country unless notification is provided to the Committees on Appropriations. Chapter III: Natural Disasters - Requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, pending receipt of a budget request, to report to the appropriate congressional committees on unfunded costs of: (1) dire emergencies due to disasters in the United States; and (2) international disaster emergencies and the threats to the oil supply, human health, and the environment resulting from the Kuwaiti oil fires. Chapter IV: Department of Commerce - Earmarks funds appropriated under the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1991 and the Dire Emergency Supplemental Appropriations for Consequences of Operation Desert Shield/Desert Storm, Food Stamps, Unemployment Compensation Administration, Veterans Compensation and Pensions, and Other Urgent Needs Act of 1991 for export promotion programs. Rescinds a specified amount of funds for salaries and expenses of courts of appeals, district courts, and other judicial services made available under the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1991. Makes available funds for defender services. Chapter V: General Provisions - Prohibits appropriations contained in this Act from remaining available for obligation beyond the current fiscal year unless expressly provided. Provides that funds in this Act are off budget. Authorizes the Secretary of Defense to accept burdensharing contributions in the form of money from the Republic of Korea for the costs of DOD Korean national employees.
